newsitem.title: UK: SQUASH-JANSHER STARTS DEFENCE WITH COMFORTABLE WIN.
newsitem.headline: SQUASH-JANSHER STARTS DEFENCE WITH COMFORTABLE WIN.

text.p: World champion Jansher Khan began his campaign for a sixth successive British Open title on Monday with a 58-minute 15-7 15-6 15-9 victory over Irish champion Derek Ryan.
It avenged a league defeat which Ryan inflicted on the top-seeded Pakistani in London recently.
"That match was a very hurried thing arranged when I missed a connection to Pakistan after winning the Austrian Open," Jansher said.
"For the British Open I have trained hard and I am fitter than last year when I was a little heavy.
"If I do not have any injury problems I think I can with again this year."
Jansher's second-round opponent will be Joseph Kniepp, an Australian qualifier who beat Paul Gregory, the 15th seeded Greek champion, 15-12 15-11 15-7.
